item.title: Team Fortress 2: Closed Captions
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
Do you...
...want to play Team Fortress 2 but are too afraid to leave Zork?
...feel that the only thing Team Fortress 2 is lacking is a novella?
...need to listen to raging death metal to play your best as Spy?
Then these captions are for you!

Goals

  • Create a complete and accurate closed-caption file for Team Fortress 2

Links

  • Download
  • Feedback (via GetSatisfaction)
  • To-Do List

Videos

Test Play

Light Color Demonstration

Dark Color Demonstration

Mono-color Demonstration

Screenshots

Light Pack

 

Dark Pack

Mono Pack

Coming soon!

Around the Web

  • Ducksoup Gaming
  • SomethingAwful
  • SteamPowered
  • Reddit

Updates

[catlist=5]

item.title: Download
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
How To Install

  1. Click below to download the zip archive with the captions inside
  2. Extract the closecaption_english.dat and closecaption_english.txt files from the ZIP archive
  3. Place them in the following folder: C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\<username>\team fortress 2\tf\resource\ Replace <username> with your steam log-in user name
  4. Open Team Fortress 2
  5. Go to the Options menu
  6. Go to the Audio menu
  7. Click the drop-down for Captions and select an option as follows:
    1. If you want to have all possible sounds, including grunts of pain and laughter, choose "Closed Captions"
    2. If you want to have only actual spoken lines, choose "Subtitles"
  8. Click the "OK" button to confirm the change
  9. Play the game with your new captions!

Download Links

  • Version .5
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.5 - Light Color
  • Version .4
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.4 - Light Color
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.4 - Dark Color
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.4 - Mono color
  • Version .3
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.3 – Light Color
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.3 – Dark Color
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.3 - Monochrome
  • Version .2
    • Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions v.2

Change Log

Version .4 - Winter 2010 Update - Released: 2010-12-20

  • Added sound-effect tags to the pain and laughter

Version .3 - Halloween 2010 Update - Released: 2010-11-03

  • Added Halloween 2010 Captions
  • Added Dark / Monochrome variants

Version .2 - Engineer Update - Released: 2010-07-14

  • Added Engineer Update captions

Version .1 - Initial Release - Released: 2010-06-12

  • Initial release of captions

How To Install
Click below to download the zip archive with the captions inside Extract the closecaption_english.dat and closecaption_english.txt files from the ZIP archive Place them in the following folder: C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\\team fortress 2\tf\resource\
Replace with your steam log-in user name Open Team Fortress 2 Go to the Options menu Go to the Audio menu Click the drop-down for Captions and select “Closed Captions” Click the “OK” button to confirm the change Play the game with your new captions!

item.title: Wow! An Update!
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
I plan on making the following changes to the caption files over the next two weeks:
  1. Refresh for Polycount update
  2. Transfer list of errors/potential errors to new site
  3. Add option for monochrome view
I know I've been dragging on this, so I hope to crank it out over this next week - we'll see what happens!

Let me know how you like the release by using the brand new Feedback form!

wp:comment.wp:comment_author: Converter Video to ipad on Mac OS X
wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Zune and iPod: Most people compare the Zune to the Touch, but after seeing how slim and surprisingly small and light it is, I consider it to be a rather unique hybrid that combines qualities of both the Touch and the Nano. It's very colorful and lovely OLED screen is slightly smaller than the touch screen, but the player itself feels quite a bit smaller and lighter. It weighs about 2/3 as much, and is noticeably smaller in width and height, while being just a hair thicker.

item.title: Team Fortress 2: The Cratening
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
Goals

  • Create an entertaining event
  • Get a few bits of rare data assigned to my digital avatar in some game
  • Become familiar with how YouTube works from the publishing side
  • Become familiar with movie editing and production
  • Become familiar with LiveStream and how it works

Summary

On October 30, 2010 I ran an event wherein I opened fifty Mann Co. Supply Crates in Valve's Team Fortress 2 at one time. With a full 32-player server as well as over 20 people viewing a live video feed, I proceeded to open the crates only to find no unusual hats. It was a great learning experience, despite the technical problems and heartbreak. I plan to run a "sequel" event with a more streamlined experience.

Links

  • The Cratening - Teaser
  • The Cratening - Intro
  • The Cratening
  • The Cratening - Aftermath

Updates

[catlist=7]

item.title: Translating the Captions
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded: Right now the only language the Team Fortress 2 Closed Captions are in are English, but I'd like to get in touch with translators in order to provide multiple language versions of the subtitles. If you know both English and non-English language and are willing to translate, please comment here or get in touch with me via the TF2:CC Feedback Form.

item.title: TF2CC - V.4 Release
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
I've gone through and added proper sound effect options for the v.4 release. Don't think there were any other changes. In order to translate the captions, use these steps:
  1. Make a copy of closecaption_english.txt
  2. Rename 'english'  to the language you want to translate to (e.g. 'closecaption_english.txt' becomes 'closecaption_danish.txt')
  3. Open your new text file and translate from english to your desired language
When done, you can either use the source caption compiler to compile the captions, or send the file to me and I will compile and distribute the captions, with credit of course.

"I have been grossly insulted," she said. It is sad to say that the demise of the United States may be due to the idiocy of its own parliament. Aforementioned: the only solution is for either party or the president himself to secede his opinion and cut his losses, literally. Republicans agreed to Obamacare, the extension of war, etc. but now it is time for President Obama to get off his high horse and secede his opinion for the betterment of the United States. We may see an annulment of his presidency have he not secede to compromise, or we may see his re-election have he take his power and agree with republicans. If Obama were to agree with democrats, the tide would still be equal, it would be a 50-50 split and no solution would be reached. The options are to compromise and settle or agree with republicans. brandi glanville iowa caucus results jerry angelo annie oakley

Find Cricket News, lifestyle news and Bollywood news on every topic at jagranpost.com. You have planned to visit this heavenly part of the world now! So, what next? How do you gather information about this place and how to start from here? If you are an international traveler, you should approach an international tourist agent from your part of the country. These agents will give you all sorts of information regarding this place and the budget. The total itinerary can be obtained in a short span of time. These agents will know about the intricate places in the parts of 60 plus mile stretch. They might have several packages and deals for different sorts of clients. For example, if you want to spend your time playing golf round the clock, you might be give a different package. If you want to spend time with your family in the amusement parks, there might be a different package. On the other hand, if you want to have a balanced deal of the two, a separate package can be offered. item.title: Homefront SP Review
item.dc:creator: pz
item.content:encoded:
It's not often that a game strikes me as thread-barren or hand-me-down, but THQ's Homefront certainly fits the bill.
In the single player campaign,
Homefront never deviates from
I'll go into detail on the multiplayer after I get more hours in, but so far it's been unimpressive. The mixture of Modern Warfare weapons and unlock system don't mesh with the BC2 style open maps. Snipers and campers tend to rule the day. The idea of spending Battle Points in a Counter-Stirke

Earn up to $3500/month just by taking simple surveys online!
I tried one of those online survey sites about 4 months ago that say all you have to do is spend a couple of minutes filling out some surveys and you will be making hundreds a day..... YEAH RIGHT, I didn't make anything.
I joined 7 of these stupid websites and I actually tried filling out a couple of surveys on each site and they took forever then at the end they wanted me to buy things or I couldn't complete the survey.
These are complete scams so be aware!!! I couldn't believe they were even allowed to sell such bogus products.
Then about 2 weeks ago I was watching the news and they had some vice presidents and marketing managers of some major multi million dollar companies talking about a site that they personally work with to pay consumers for their opinion, A site that actually just wants the "average Joe's" honest opinion on products and services and is willing to pay big money to get them. for more information clik here: http://get-money-for-taking-surveys.info
